rows.title: Apotheosis
rows.titleText:
You are a god.

Or ... it would be more accurate to say that you are becoming a god. Maybe you made a wish, or nibbled on the corpse of the moon, or simply awoke the divine spark that always lived inside you — but either way, you can feel yourself filling with divine power.

It is a lot. But you are still in control of your transformation, and holding on to those parts of yourself that are most important should not prove too difficult.

How difficult do you find it, to direct your transformation?

objects.title: Easy
objects.text: You find guiding the divine force within you easy, quickly finding a pattern that you're happy with.

objects.title: Normal
objects.text: You find guiding the divine force within you somewhat tricky, but manage to wrestle it into the proper forms with some effort.

objects.title: Hard
objects.text: You must fight at every step of the transformation to keep your divine force where you want it to be. You have little attention to spare.

rows.title: Limits of Power
rows.titleText:
As you transform, you can instinctively feel that you can maintain more of a grip on your transformation if you pull yourself in, or curl yourself up.

Do you accept limits on your power?

objects.title: No limits
objects.text: No! You are a god, unbound by limits. Your will is endless, and your power can stretch wherever or whenever your attention directs it.

objects.title: A planet
objects.text: There is one planet where you choose to focus your attention. Though you may expand in time, as worshipers bring you to new places, for now reaching beyond the orbit of the moon is beyond you.

objects.title: A country
objects.text: There is one large country over which you can extend your reach. Growth will be harder, and extending any power outside your borders harder still.

objects.title: A village
objects.text: You curl tightly against yourself, putting your back to the world to resist the onslaught of the universe. Your power is tied to a single physical location — a shrine, perhaps — and can extend only a few miles around it.

rows.title: Limits of Knowledge
rows.titleText:
But there are multiple facets to being a god. Multiple ... directions in which you can contort yourself.

Do you accept limits on your knowledge?

objects.title: No limits
objects.text: No! You are a god, unbound by limits. Your consciousness extends throughout the cosmos, able to attend to anything that you will.

objects.title: Knowledge of the Sapient
objects.text: If you limit the flow of the divine, you can restrict yourself to only those things that mortals know. This is not as restrictive as it sounds — if any mortal, anywhere knows of it, you can too. But completely unknown dangers will blindside you.

objects.title: Knowledge of the Believers
objects.text: Tightening yourself still further, you can limit yourself to the things that those who believe you are a god know. They don't have to be faithful, or like you, they must merely accept your divinity for their minds to lay open before you.

objects.title: Knowledge of the Devout
objects.text: You block out the sounds of the cosmos, to focus only on what you can handle. Only things known by your devout followers, who truly believe in you and your teachings, can reach you.

rows.title: Limits of Benevolence
rows.titleText:
There is one last direction available to you — indeed, available to all thinking creatures. One last way to shelter your core self against the onslaught of the universe.

Do you accept limits on your benevolence?

objects.title: No limits
objects.text: No! You are a god, but more than that — you are capable of recognizing that every being is unique, and at least worth hearing out. You may not care for everyone equally, but it is your choice. The universe cannot force you to be cruel.

objects.title: Humanoids
objects.text: You are losing so much of what you were already. But you can cling, at least, to this much: you were human once, and you shall always have a fondness for those of similar form, beyond any others.

objects.title: Your chosen people
objects.text: You can't help everyone; your heart would break under the strain of it. But if you just restrict yourself to your chosen few ... you can care for them, and harden your heart to the rest of the cosmos.

objects.title: Yourself
objects.text: Or you can pull yourself in as tightly as possible, and cut all your connections to life outside yourself. You are a god now, and what care do you have for mortal creatures? You will always have yourself.

rows.title: Application of Power
rows.titleText: Now that you have shepherded your will, you have some to spare for expanding your capabilities. There are ways that you can reach out, now that you're a god, that seem as easy and as natural as breathing.

objects.title: Light touches
objects.text: You can exert light touches anywhere within the limits of your power. Nudge a falling rock, block a heart, wipe away a tear. With enough time, you may even shift the course of asteroids.

objects.title: Bounty of the Earth
objects.text: By letting your power flow through the land, you can shape the plants and animals. Create bountiful farmlands, or dangerous forests.

objects.title: Transformations
objects.text: You can see that all matter is really the same, and reach out to change it's underlying expression. Turn water into wine, or a human into a swan. The only limit is the forms you can comprehend.

objects.title: Miracles
objects.text: By channeling your power through your followers, you can do anything they ask for. Their wishes are all yours to grant, or to withhold.

objects.title: Illusions
objects.text: You can conjure up images, send visions, and generally manipulate the perceptions of those within your domain.

objects.title: Sharing
objects.text: By imbuing a spark of your divine nature into a mortal, you can elevate them to the level of a demigod. They might still die, your spark returning to you. Or they might figure out how to awaken it, as you once did.

objects.title: Movement
objects.text: Separation is an illusion. You can pull aside the veil, and move anything within your domain to anywhere else, either by teleportation, portals, or any other means.

objects.title: True Omnipotence
objects.text: Anything. You can do absolutely anything at all. Nothing is beyond you.

rows.title: Sources of Knowledge
rows.titleText: All gods gain a basic awareness of their followers. What other sources of knowledge will you reach out for?

objects.title: The present
objects.text: You can see what is currently happening anywhere — within the limits of your knowledge, of course.

objects.title: The past
objects.text: You can see things as they were, in truth, at any point in the past.

objects.title: The future
objects.text: This choice is, perhaps, least bound by your limits. You can see what will happen if you do nothing — although, if you limited yourself to mortal knowledge, the possibility still must be one they might anticipate.

objects.title: The odds
objects.text: You can see how likely different outcomes are, based on different actions that you could take.

objects.title: Prayers
objects.text: You can hear prayers addressed to you, along with a sense of where and whom they come from.

objects.title: Psyches
objects.text: You may peer into the minds of mortals, and read their thoughts, emotions, and memories. But knowledge is not understanding.

objects.title: Physics
objects.text: You can see how the underlying rules of the world, whatever they might be, operate.

objects.title: True Omniscence
objects.text: You are instantly and effortlessly aware of everything that you could know.

rows.title: Feelings of Empathy
rows.titleText: Completing your transformation has transformed you, and mortals are now distant and strange. How much ability to understand them have you held onto?

objects.title: Emotions
objects.text: You retain your own emotions, and the ability to recognize them in others.

objects.title: Empathy
objects.text: You can still empathize with mortals in the same way as before, truly understanding their pain.

objects.title: Theory of mind
objects.text: You remember what is and is not obvious to mortals, and can always tell what they will conclude from a miracle or vision.

objects.title: Connections
objects.text: You can easily interpret thoughts that are not your own, allowing you to translate with perfect fidelity between other beings.

objects.title: A gentle touch
objects.text: You always understand how to present or phrase things in order to minimize or magnify emotional impact.

objects.title: A true love
objects.text: When you love someone, they can tell. A feeling of divine grace permeates their being, and they know that you are there for them.

objects.title: A wide net
objects.text: You can recognize and empathize with even very strange mortals. Anything anywhere that feels or thinks is not beyond your understanding, if you try.

objects.title: True Omnibenevolence
objects.text: You always know what is best for everyone. Not just what will make them happy, but what will make them strong, fulfilled, proud, and every other positive thing that they want to be. You will never make a mistake out of flawed comprehension again.

rows.title: The offer
rows.titleText:
There is only one way to be perfect.
As soon as you commit to your choices, all the possible paths unfold in front of you, and you see that you are not alone. There are already ten thousand or more deities, walking the same path that you have chosen, all urging each other on, all working together to hammer the universe into an acceptable shape.
And they do not need to say a word for you to understand their offer: merge with them, join your power to their own, and transcend.

objects.title: Remain yourself
objects.text: There is power in diversity, and in redundancy. You may be less efficient, but you will be more robust. The project of Good must continue, in all its myriad forms, no matter what happens.

objects.title: Join the Spirit of Goodness and Wonder, Acknowledged by All Peoples, that some people Know as God
objects.text: Many hands make light work. Focusing so heavily on being able to understand what is right has diminished what you might be capable of on your own — but it can never dull what you can all accomplish together. Join the great work, and be as one.

rows.title: A last push
rows.titleText: You have chosen what kind of god you will be, now. You know what you want to do, and how you will do it. But there is one last place that you can spend the force of your ascension: a one-time burst of visions and miracles that will firmly establish you on your chosen world.

objects.title: Stand on your own
objects.text: You have no need for visions or miracles — your actions will speak for themselves, and you will gain a following in time.

objects.title: A prophet
objects.text: You inspire the singular most suited person in your domain, touching them with the knowledge of what you are.

objects.title: A group
objects.text: A scattering of a few tens of especially open-minded people become aware of your divinity and your nature.

objects.title: A known truth
objects.text: Thousands of people across your domain experience the truth of you in their dreams, and know it for truth, and go out into the world to share it.

rows.title: The blind god
rows.titleText: You limited yourself to the knowledge of your believers — but nobody believes. You are left blind and deaf in the dark, knowing nothing but yourself.

rows.title: The beginning
rows.titleText:
Your transformation is complete. There are thousands more choices left to make, but they are not simple choices, linear and easily weighed against one another. No, now you have the true freedom that comes with power, knowledge, and understanding.

This is only the beginning of your story. What will you do from here?
